variations.name: Incline Push-Up
instructions: Place hands on elevated surface (bench, box, or wall)
Position hands slightly wider than shoulder-width
Keep body in straight line from head to heels
Lower chest toward surface by bending elbows
Push back up to starting position
Maintain core engagement throughout movement

variations.name: Standard Push-Up
instructions: Start in plank position with hands directly under shoulders
Feet together, body forming straight line
Lower body by bending elbows, keeping them at 45-degree angle
Descend until chest nearly touches ground
Push through palms to return to starting position
Keep core tight and hips level throughout

variations.name: Decline Push-Up
instructions: Place feet on elevated surface (bench or box)
Hands on ground, slightly wider than shoulder-width
Maintain straight body alignment
Lower chest toward ground with controlled movement
Push up explosively to starting position
Focus on upper chest and anterior deltoid engagement

variations.name: Diamond Push-Up
instructions: Start in standard push-up position
Place hands together forming diamond shape with thumbs and index fingers
Keep elbows close to body during descent
Lower until chest nearly touches hands
Push up focusing on triceps contraction
Maintain strict form - no sagging or arching

variations.name: Archer Push-Up
instructions: Start in wide push-up position
Shift weight to one side while extending opposite arm
Lower body toward working arm side
Keep extended arm straight and elevated
Push up to center position
Alternate sides for each repetition
Requires significant shoulder stability and core strength

variations.name: Assisted Pull-Up
instructions: Use resistance band or assistance machine
Grasp bar with overhand grip, shoulder-width apart
Hang with arms fully extended
Pull body up until chin clears bar
Control descent to full extension
Focus on engaging lats and biceps
Reduce assistance as strength improves

variations.name: Standard Pull-Up
instructions: Hang from bar with overhand grip, shoulder-width apart
Engage core and retract shoulder blades
Pull body up by driving elbows down and back
Continue until chin clears bar
Lower with control to full arm extension
Maintain hollow body position throughout
Avoid kipping or swinging

variations.name: Wide Grip Pull-Up
instructions: Grasp bar with overhand grip, wider than shoulder-width
Hang with arms fully extended
Focus on lat engagement from the start
Pull up emphasizing back muscles over biceps
Bring chest toward bar at top
Lower with full control
Requires greater shoulder mobility and lat strength

variations.name: L-Sit Pull-Up
instructions: Begin in hanging position with legs extended in L-sit
Maintain L-sit position throughout entire movement
Pull body up while keeping legs parallel to ground
Bring chest to bar with legs elevated
Lower with control maintaining L-sit
Requires exceptional core strength and hip flexibility
Advanced progression combining pull strength with core stability

variations.name: Bench Dip
instructions: Sit on edge of bench with hands gripping edge
Slide forward so bodyweight is supported by arms
Lower body by bending elbows
Descend until elbows reach 90-degree angle
Push up to starting position
Keep feet on ground for assistance if needed
Focus on triceps engagement

variations.name: Standard Dip
instructions: Support bodyweight on parallel bars or dip station
Start with arms fully extended, body vertical
Lower body by bending elbows
Descend until shoulders are below elbows
Push up explosively to starting position
Keep core engaged and avoid swinging
Focus on triceps and anterior deltoids

variations.name: Ring Dip
instructions: Support bodyweight on gymnastic rings
Start with arms extended, rings turned out
Lower body with controlled movement
Rings will naturally turn inward during descent
Push up while turning rings back out
Requires significant shoulder stability and wrist strength
Much more challenging than bar dips due to instability

variations.name: Weighted Dip
instructions: Perform standard dip with added weight
Use dip belt or weighted vest
Start with light weight and progress gradually
Maintain strict form throughout movement
Lower with control, push up explosively
Focus on progressive overload
Ensure shoulder mobility before adding weight

variations.name: Assisted Pistol Squat
instructions: Hold onto support (pole, TRX, or door frame)
Lift one leg straight out in front
Lower body on standing leg while maintaining balance
Descend as low as possible with control
Use support to assist balance and strength
Push up through heel to return to standing
Focus on ankle mobility and hip flexibility

variations.name: Standard Pistol Squat
instructions: Stand on one leg with other leg extended forward
Lower body by bending standing leg
Keep extended leg parallel to ground
Descend until hamstring touches calf
Maintain upright torso throughout movement
Push through heel to return to standing
Requires exceptional leg strength, balance, and flexibility

variations.name: Elevated Pistol Squat
instructions: Stand on elevated surface (box or platform)
Allow non-working leg to hang down
Lower body on standing leg
Descend until hamstring touches calf
Push up to starting position
Easier than standard due to reduced range of motion
Good progression toward full pistol squat

variations.name: Weighted Pistol Squat
instructions: Perform standard pistol squat with added weight
Hold weight plate, kettlebell, or dumbbell
Maintain strict form despite added load
Lower with control, push up explosively
Requires mastery of bodyweight version first
Extreme test of single-leg strength and stability
Progressive overload for advanced athletes

variations.name: Strict Muscle-Up
instructions: Hang from bar with false grip (wrists over bar)
Pull up explosively until chest reaches bar
Transition by rotating wrists and pushing down
Complete transition to support position
Lower with control back to hang
No kipping or momentum allowed
Requires exceptional pulling and pushing strength

variations.name: Kipping Muscle-Up
instructions: Hang from bar with standard grip
Generate momentum with leg swing (kip)
Pull up as momentum peaks
Use momentum to assist transition
Complete transition to support position
Lower with control
Easier than strict but requires coordination

variations.name: Ring Muscle-Up
instructions: Hang from gymnastic rings with false grip
Pull up explosively
Transition by turning rings out and pushing
Complete transition to support position
Rings require greater stability than bar
Much more challenging due to instability
Ultimate test of upper body strength and coordination

variations.name: Assisted Muscle-Up
instructions: Use resistance band for assistance
Place band around bar and foot or knee
Perform muscle-up with reduced bodyweight
Focus on proper transition technique
Reduce assistance as strength improves
Good progression toward unassisted muscle-up
Practice false grip and transition separately
